net.researchgate.kafka.metamorph

Interface PartitionConsumer<K,V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable

    public interface PartitionConsumer<K,V>
extends java.io.Closeable
    A Kafka consumer interface for consumption of a topic partition

    It allows the discovery of available partitions of a given topic and the ability to bind to exactly one topic partition to consume data from it. The interface allows full control over the offset but also allows the underlying implementation to handle offset control autonomously while iterating over the records.

    This interface is heavily inspired by the new unified consumer interface introduced within Kafka 0.9.0 but is backwards compatible to older Kafka version since it relies on its own data representations. Also it allows only a subset of operations (e.g. only possible to consume one partition per consumer instance) which simplifies the concrete implementation in older Kafka versions.

    • Method Detail

      • partitionsFor

        java.util.Collection<TopicPartition> partitionsFor(java.lang.String topic)
        Get partitions for a given topic
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to get partitions for
        Returns:
        The list of partitions
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)

      • assign

        void assign(TopicPartition partition)
        Manually assign a partition to this consumer. This interface allows to bind to only one partition at a time.
        Parameters:
        partition - The partition to assign this consumer
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)

      • getAssignment

        TopicPartition getAssignment()
        Get currently assigned topic partition
        Returns:
        currently assigned TopicPartition or null if there is no assignment

      • poll

        java.util.List<PartitionConsumerRecord<K,V>> poll(int timeout)
        Fetch data for the assigned partition. It is an error if the consumer is not assigned to any partition before polling.

        On each poll, consumer will try to use the last consumed offset as the starting offset and fetch sequentially. The last consumed offset can be manually set through seek(long)

        Parameters:
        timeout - The time, in milliseconds, spent waiting in poll if data is not available in the buffer. If 0, returns immediately with any records that are available currently in the buffer, else returns empty. Must not be negative.
        Returns:
        Fetched records for the assigned partition
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)

      • position

        long position()
        Get the offset of the next record that will be fetched for the assigned partition (if a record with that offset exists). It is an error if the consumer is not assigned to a partition before invoking this method.
        Returns:
        The offset
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)

      • earliestPosition

        long earliestPosition()
        Get the earliest offset for the assigned partition It is an error if the consumer is not assigned to a partition before invoking this method.
        Returns:
        The offset
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)

      • latestPosition

        long latestPosition()
        Get the latest offset for the assigned partition It is an error if the consumer is not assigned to a partition before invoking this method.
        Returns:
        The offset
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)

      • seek

        void seek(long offset)
        Explicitly sets the fetch offset which will be used on the next poll(timeout) It is an error if the consumer is not assigned to a partition before invoking this method.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset which will be used on the next poll(timeout)
        Throws:
        PartitionConsumerException - when an unrecoverable error occurs (e.g. no broker available)
